Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of a Washington Times front page declaring Al Gore the winner of the 2000 election.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Washington Times never ran a front page declaring Al Gore the winner of the 2000 election.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fabricated image that has been widely spread on social media.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the media's call on the 2020 election should not be trusted based on a false comparison to the 2000 election.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the media's call on the 2020 election is based on projections and official results, while the 2000 election had a different outcome.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting a misleading image and misrepresenting the facts of the 2000 election.
Understate: There is no evident understatement bias in the claim.
